channel.title: BBC News - London
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Newham event remembers Londoners killed by violence
item.description: The event was organised by the family of Jan Mustafa, who was murdered in Newham in 2018.

item.title: Man sought after dog attack on 11-year-old girl in Tower Hamlets
item.description: The girl was walking to school in east London when the "shocking" attack left her in hospital.

item.title: Train strikes: RMT union rejects offer to stop Christmas walkouts
item.description: Talks between the RMT and train operators aimed at halting the walkouts are expected to continue.

item.title: Raheem Sterling leaves England World Cup squad after armed break-in at family home
item.description: Raheem Sterling is leaving the England World Cup squad in Qatar after a break-in that occurred at his home in the UK while his family were in.

item.title: PwC to close offices at Christmas to save energy
item.description: Staff at the accountancy firm won't be able to work from its main London office over the festive period.

item.title: Knightsbridge steakhouse: Animal rebellion activists removed from site
item.description: Two demonstrations were held in upmarket restaurants in London and Manchester on Saturday.

item.title: Ngozi Fulani: Dialogue held over Buckingham Palace remarks, BBC told
item.description: Ngozi Fulani told the BBC her encounter with Lady Susan Hussey was like an "interrogation".

item.title: Museum of London closes Barbican venue ahead of move
item.description: The museum is moving down the road to West Smithfield and hopes to have its grand reopening in 2026.

item.title: Police watchdog head Michael Lockwood resigns amid investigation
item.description: The home secretary says Michael Lockwood is the subject of a probe into a historical allegation.

item.title: Ngozi Fulani: Lady Susan Hussey's race comments were abuse, says charity boss
item.description: Ngozi Fulani tells the BBC her encounter with Lady Susan Hussey was like an "interrogation".

item.title: Woman’s harasser caught using new police software
item.description: Leena’s ex-boyfriend was brought to justice with the help of new software used by Met Police detectives.

item.title: Dread Broadcasting Corporation: The pirate that changed British radio
item.description: Europe's first dedicated black music station, Dread Broadcasting Corporation

item.title: Meet the London property developer turned beekeeper
item.description: Khalid Undre started with six hives and says more beehives and keepers are needed in the capital.

item.title: Reading 1-0 Tottenham: Amy Turner own goal gives Royals second win of WSL season
item.description: Reading move seven points clear of the Women's Super League relegation zone as Amy Turner's first-half own goal gives them victory over Tottenham.

item.title: Liverpool 2-0 West Ham: Dominant Reds claim first WSL win since opening day
item.description: Liverpool claim a first Women's Super League win since the opening day of the season with a commanding win at home to West Ham.

item.title: Tyson Fury v Derek Chisora: 'Gypsy King' retains WBC world heavyweight title as Oleksandr Usyk watches ringside
item.description: Tyson Fury retains his WBC world heavyweight title with a brutal 10th-round stoppage of Derek Chisora and set up a potential undisputed showdown with Oleksandr Usyk.

item.title: Sunderland 3-0 Millwall: Black Cats roar into life in rousing second half
item.description: Sunderland's rousing second-half display secures a convincing Championship victory against Millwall.

item.title: Premiership: London Irish 39-17 Newcastle Falcons: Exiles off bottom
item.description: London Irish move off the bottom of the Premiership with a pulsating win over Newcastle Falcons.
